payroll.payroll_frequency: Monthly, by no later than  the last day of the month

working_hours.working_hours: 8 hours per day, up to 48 hours per week.

leave.public_holidays:
Holidays falling on a Sunday are moved to the following Monday.
Date	Day	Holiday	Notes
1 Jan 2025	Wednesday	New Year’s Day	
3 Feb 2025	Monday	Mozambican Heroes’ Day	
7 Apr 2025	Monday	Mozambican Woman’s Day	
1 May 2025	Thursday	Labour/May Day	
25 Jun 2025	Wednesday	Independence Day	
7 Sep 2025	Sunday	Victory Day	
8 Sep 2025	Monday	Victory Day Holiday	Day Off in Lieu
25 Sep 2025	Thursday	Armed Forces Day	
4 Oct 2025	Saturday	Peace & Reconciliation Day	
25 Dec 2025	Thursday	Family Day
leave.sick_leave: 15 days of paid sick leave or 5 non-consecutive days per quarter paid by the Employer. Additional paid sick leave might be granted by Social Security at a workers request to the health board, up to 365 days of continuous sick leave.
leave.maternity_leave: In Mozambique, female employees are entitled to 60 days of paid maternity leave, which can start up to 20 days before the due date. The benefits are paid through Mozambique’s social security system. Employees receive 100% of their average daily earnings if they have made at least 12 months of contributions in the 18 months before the expected due date. While the law allows for 90 days of maternity leave, the social security system only pays for 60 days. The 90-day leave applies in cases of full-term or premature delivery, regardless of whether it was a live or stillborn birth.

termination.notice_period: There is no at-will termination via a notice period though it is standard to give 1 week’s notice during Probation and 1 months notice thereafter.
termination.severance: Severance payable for termination due to “structural, technological, or market reasons” is changed to 30 days’ salary per year of service for workers whose base salary (including seniority bonus) is between one and seven times the sector minimum wage; 15 days per year of service for workers whose salary is between seven and 18 times the minimum wage; and five days per year for workers whose salary is greater than 18 times the minimum wage (previously 20 days’ salary per year of service in all cases).
